intro: Astragalus bigelovii f. macdougalii, commonly known as the MacDougal's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has a deep root system that helps it survive in poor soil conditions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional herbal use.
